s.text: --which is how Laurence Olivier and Kenneth Branagh play him in the two movie versions of Henry V . But read the play more closely and you realize that the cheerfully successful king bears little resemblance to the man Shakespeare created.

It is also fitting that the character chosen by the authors of Shakespeare in Charge: The Bard's Guide to Leading and Succeeding on the Business Stage as a role model for CEOs is Henry V. Hal, as he is called, is widely acknowledged to be the playwright's most Machiavellian hero.

It is also fitting that the character chosen by the authors of Shakespeare in Charge: The Bard's Guide to Leading and Succeeding on the Business Stage as a role model for CEOs is Henry V. Hal, as he is called, is widely acknowledged to be the playwright's most Machiavellian hero.

Rather than pardon the poor fool, Henry has him killed in order to show the French that his is an orderly army that means them no real harm.
Rather than pardon the poor fool, Henry has him killed in order to show the French that his is an orderly army that means them no real harm.

To sum up, then: What does Shakespeare really have to say to businessmen who think that his kings make good role models--rather than, say, troubling, interesting, morally questionable dramatizations of the effects of power?
I have long dream'd of such a kind of man, So surfeit-swell'd, so old and so profane; But, being awaked, I do despise my dream.

Rather than pardon the poor fool, Henry has him killed in order to show the French that his is an orderly army that means them no real harm.
Just before the great battle with the French at Agincourt, Henry V is told that Bardolph, a member of his old gang, has been caught stealing a small statue of Christ from a local church.
(The Brothers Grimm and A. A. Milne, author of Winnie the Pooh , dabble in that line of work too, but their output is noncompetitive--only one book to Machiavelli's and Shakespeare's several each.)
Upon receiving the proposal, he asks England's bishops several times to give him a clear justification for the invasion, which will necessarily entail the deaths of thousands of men.
